page.title: 07Hegderows.
page.content: As well as hawthorn holly, willow, sloe, viburnum, hazel, elder, oak, beech, wych elm, bird cherry gorse and gooseberry make up the hedgerows. Crab apple is common and allowed to grow to full size. Wild flowers are plentiful and varied. Snowdrop and Harebell are common. Less common ones include Great bell flower, Mimulus, Maschatel, Rest harrow, Great burnet, Heath, Common and Butterfly Orchid and Winter aconite. Stoats, with ermine coats in winter, hedgehogs, moles, shrews and wood-mice abound. The rabbit population fluctuates. In the Tarn area you might occasionally sight a fallow deer or a badger. Foxes are widespread, there are hares in the fields between Farlam and the Tarn and red squirrels in the Gelt Woods.
